meanings.definition: To remove or reduce the sexual characteristics or aspects of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist was desexualizing the painting by covering up the revealing parts.
meanings.sent2: The school decided to desexualize the dress code to promote a more professional environment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about desexualizing a romantic movie by replacing all the kissing scenes with high-fives.
meanings.sent4: She was desexualizing her social media profile, turning it into a platform for intellectual discussions.
meanings.sent5: The campaign aimed at desexualizing advertisements to create a more inclusive society.

meanings.definition: To make something less sexual in nature.
meanings.sent1: The company was desexualizing their marketing campaigns to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: The new guidelines were aimed at desexualizing the content of the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer was desexualizing the runway show by opting for elegant and modest designs.
meanings.sent4: By desexualizing the lyrics, the song became suitable for all age groups.
meanings.sent5: The therapist recommended desexualizing the relationship to focus on emotional connection.
